Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2016 01:57PM suzydthatisme wrote: The same thing is happening to me: no palpable lump but architectural distortion on my screening mammo. They did a core stereotactic biopsy - all 5 samples came back 'no malignancy detected', but they want to do a repeat biopsy to 'ensure sampling '. So.....I'm scheduled for tomorrow. Has anyone else here had this experience??
Posts.Title: Discordant results from stereotactic biopsy Rottiemom33 Dena_01

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2016 10:47AM suzydthatisme wrote: My gosh, you are the most gorgeous gal!  Good luck to you and many congrats on your new life together!
Posts.Title: Diagnosed on 513/16 and getting married 6/12/2016 Maegtexas suzydthatisme

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2016 12:10PM suzydthatisme wrote: I had a repeat core biopsy two weeks ago. The first biopsy 'wasn't concordant' with the mammogram pictures, which means the mammogram looked worse than the benign biopsy results that I got in my first biopsy. The re-did the core and they found radial scar with a tiny bit of atypical ductal hyperplasia in the middle. So.....I'm now headed for a surgical excision of the area as they don't like to fool around with radial scars or atypical ductal hyperplasia. My hope is that they don't find anything more sinister when they do the excisional removal. Even though radial scar and atypical hyperplasia are benign conditions, they still raise my risk of breast cancer. So.....I don't think this will ever be truly 'over' for me. :-(
Posts.Title: Second biopsy on same lump? MaryLLL marie5890

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2016 08:50AM - edited Feb 13, 2016 08:51AM by suzydthatisme Thanks so much for all the replies and information......it really helps to know people are watching out for you!  Good luck to you, Sherri and flamom.  I'll keep you posted on what's going on and please let me know how things go with you.  xox to all!
Posts.Title: Scared! They found alot of concerns! Sherri-lynn02 Sherri-lynn02

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2018 02:29PM suzydthatisme wrote: My screening mammogram and subsequent tomosynthesis also showed architectural distortion and they took 5 samples from the area during the biopsy.  They freeze you with the same stuff that they use at the dentist and honestly the biopsy was easier than a dental procedure.  I felt no pain at the sight during or after.   My biopsy showed abnormal cells so they did a diagnostic lumpectomy (which wasn't bad, either) and in the end they found DCIS (stage 0 breast cancer).  I didn't need any further treatment.....just yearly mammograms and 6 month follow-ups with an oncologist.  My experience with the biopsy and lumpectomy was painless - it's just the fear that gets the best of us.
Posts.Title: Birad4 Kathryn1894 momto3sons

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2016 01:21PM suzydthatisme wrote: Back in December I went for a bi-annual screening mammogram and was called back a week later for a tomosynthesis scan, which is sort of like a 3D mammogram. The tomosynthesis scan results were rated Birads 4C, which put me in a bit of a panic. I had no palpable lump. They were seeing an architectural distortion but no solid mass. I had a core biopsy, which found nothing, so they did another core biopsy, which confirmed a radial scar and a very small area of atypical ductal hyperplasia. I'm waiting now for a surgery date to remove the dodgy area and I've been told that 20% of the time they find DCIS in circumstances such as mine. Anyway, I'm relieved that it wasn't full on cancer but I'm still at high risk. So....that's my Birads 4C story.
Posts.Title: Quick question regarding birads Patti72

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2016 01:44PM suzydthatisme wrote: Hi Sherri-lynn02, I think you and I are going through similar things at the same time. I had a repeat biopsy a week after my first biopsy, which the pathologist and radiologist felt wasn't concordant with the mammogram results (which were 4c). The first biopsy said 'no malignancy noted'. I got my 2nd biopsy results on Thursday: 'focal atypical ductal hyperplasia within radial sclerosing lesion'. Nobody has explained this to me and the only info. I can get is off the net, which can be alarming to say the least. My family doc has referred me to a breast surgeon at the local breast health clinic.....I'm still waiting for the surgical consult date. At the end of my pathology report it says: 'surgical excision is recommended to rule out more extensive disease'. It sounds to me like there are some high risk things in your pathology report (as there are in mine) and they like to remove those to be safe.
